1.text: Bring your soup to a gentle simmer on the stove.

2.text: Stir the liquid so the foaming fat moves to the edges of the stockpot.

3.text: Scoop up the foaming fat with a fine mesh skimming utensil.

4.text: Use the back of a cold metal spoon if you don’t have a mesh skimming utensil.

5.text: Remove any vegetables, meat, or noodles before straining the soup.

6.text: Cool the broth until the fat particles just start to solidify.

7.text: Pour the broth through a gravy separator if you want to skim the fat quickly.

8.text: Strain the broth through a kitchen towel if you don’t have a separator.

9.text: Chill the soup in the refrigerator overnight.

10.text: Scoop away the solidified fat with a spoon if you’re skimming a thick soup.

11.text: Pour chilled soup a hole in a plastic bag if you’re skimming broth.
